metadata.title: CVE-2023-21963 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Connection Handling). Supported versions that are affected are5.7.40 and prior and 8.0.31 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service(partial DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 2.7 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-21963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-common - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.41-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1').
mariadb-10.0 package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
percona-server-5.6 package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
